Torchbox

Oxford Geek Nights #25

| 7:30pm

Keynotes

Keynote speakers are invited to talk at Oxford Geek Nights. So far our confirmed keynotes for OGN25 are:

  • How to make rowing sexy: a web video case study, by Tom Wilkinson, Online Media Producer at the University of Oxford (slides, audio)
  • Getting geeks singing with Javascript, by Matthew Westcott, Senior Developer at Torchbox (slides, audio)

Microslots

Microslots are five-minute "lightning talks" that anyone can volunteer for. They consist of around five to ten slides and the audience is generally friendly and interested! Here are the confirmed microslots for OGN25:

  • Solr: Your One Stop Search Shop, by Chris Rimmer (slides, audio)
  • Access in the cloud: databases as webservices, by James Webster (audio)
  • OxBus, or: how I learned to stop worrying about when the bus would arrive and do something about it instead, by Matthew Owen (slides, audio)
  • Existential risks and AI, by Stuart Armstrong (slides, audio)
  • Refresh Oxford hack day, by George Hickman (slides, audio)

Want to volunteer a microslot for OGN26 some time in April/May? Submit your idea here and we'll see you on the night!

Oxford Geek Night is a regular meet-up for designers & developers run by Torchbox

We have two keynote talks of 15 minutes each followed by a handful of 5 minute micro-slots.
